RFVRqPCi_V29FXptUXZkaw.text: I had lunch here for the first time today. I made reservations via phone. We had the wild rocket burger, mushroom and cheese burger, coconut and gula melaka milkshake, flat white, onion rings and churros waffle. We both enjoyed our burgers which came with a healthy serving of beef (you can choose how well you want it and medium was perfect for me, also a choice of fries or salad). The milkshake which my friend had was supposedly great, while I prefer my flat white stronger and less acidic. Onion rings were decent with a very tasty curry sauce on the side. I loved the churros waffles though a teensy dry, had a perfect cinnamon sugar coating. Paired with chocolate, it made for a good dessert without tasting overly heavy. Service was really good - staff were attentive and very pleasant. It was a pleasure dining here and I will be back for more. The bill was about $95 for 2 persons.

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore

Ju8tp071cH6bC6rHnizDDA.text: This place was a random find for us, but the burgers were amazing!  They are the best burgers we've had since arriving in Singapore.  The service was really friendly and the little mall was good for running the kid around while we waited for the food.  The strawberry milk shake was worth it on the way out as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore

zltfMhEEaXKBCC9P5QS34Q.text: Chili crab burger - 2.5 starsDidn't like how they fried the crab (with a thick fish and chips sort of batter), and the bun was well-toasted, which made it dry as a result.Calamansi mint juice - 2 starsIt was too dilute.Hae bee hiam spaghettini - 3.75 starsThe scallops were pretty small and not terribly fresh or flavorful, but you can't argue with a well-done sambal belachan and angel hair pasta.Ambience - 5 starsThis is what I'd go for. Large, roomy, with a nice view.Service - 3.5 starsThey forgot to bring our bill.

y0SMKzo6p5cY--8gsRk7nw.text: great service and food, located right next to Botanic Gardens MRT.there's no close (great) eateries in the northern part of Botanic Gardens, where D and I frequent with our little boy. so this restaurant is the perfect place for us to unwind after a long day visiting the children's park and walking around Singapore's version of Central park.  The restaurant, located right next to Cold Storage, has a warm and homely feel, and serves decent food- the house burger and the egg's benedict was delicious and I can't wait to come back to try the other unique gourmet burgers. But the highlight of the night was the homemade lemonade- it was served in a cute mason jar and was fresh and delish that i was wishing it came in the larger size!- and the service. Our egg's benedict came around 15 minutes later than the burger, and though we didn't make any complaint about it and frankly, we were too busy watching over the baby to even notice, the server came over and apologized for the wait and said the dish was on the house. It was just really nice and thoughtful gesture that you don't see too often in Asia. love the cozy atmosphere, love the food. perfect for dates and for families as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken wings! It was okay
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Homemade lemonade!

u75rfVOGPOge7rAtWDhJCw.text: Just happened by this place after a concert at the Botanic Gardens.  The burgers are really great, very big and cooked just right.  The mushroom is also very good.  My wife liked the turnip salad too, quite different.  It's a bit pricey though for a burger place.

0jyZO6OT7D8lWWW9R2Gwcg.text: Excellent burgers, always. And the churros waffle with dark chocolate dip was soooo good. Sugary, cinnamony, crisp and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Churros waffle with dark chocolate dip

pH1BXQWLON3VWPjP9ILsGw.text: Nice decoration but the price have no sense. 20$ for a burger good but not big or spectacular and for this price you must to choice salad Or fries but not both !!! Beer 17$Ok the Singapore customer have budget but they are smart as well !!! No ? ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore

VIS5bNW9CSBSHOyiSks53g.text: Clean, simple, good service, good burger, great beer paring, good onions rings, decent fries.I had a bacon and cheeseburger, paired with their recommended German beer and it was great. The onion rings were also quite fresh, and service was polite and they had our burgers our super quickly.Don't order the SPAM fries though, they were not especially tasty. It's upstairs on the 2nd floor if you can't find it...I think it's mostly a local place, we were the only Westerners there.

JGpAMuWT29LUArImb35eEg.text: Yum! Having being somewhat disappointed by Bruno Menard's &made, I was not all that keen on another burger. But my bf convinced me otherwise, and happily so :) The blue cheese/pear burger was so much more worth the $20.90 than the $19 B burger at &made! Or I guess I just appreciated the mix of flavours more. Also, love the  walnut-peanut butter that came with! I'm quite a sucker for chunky nut butters.We also split a thai minced pork basil prata pizza ($11) - very interesting.. very Asian, and very oily. Flavours were pretty good, nice spice and pork bits! But there really was quite a lot of oil.. :/Mushroom soup ($8 or so I believe?) was fairly chunky and full of mushrooms, reminded me of a version that my friend made - basically he just had a pot of different types of mushrooms and stuck an immersion blender in.. voila, mushroom soup! More truffle oil would've been good. But nice and comforting, anyhow :)Our server was very observant (noticed bf's medicine sitting on the table and asked if he was feeling better - I was quite impressed) and friendly, props to him! Encouraged us to come back for dinner (apparently they have a somewhat different menu for dinner vs. brunch).

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Delicious bleu cheese pear Auvergne burger w salad!
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Thai basil pork pizza (spicy!!)
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore. Mushroom soup

V_R-nc83goXjDmKnKwF-GQ.text: I love this spot for its simplicity and impeccable and inviting staff. Every time I am here, I honesty feel as if I'm eating at home. Relaxing and engaging staff. I not a fan of many things on the menu. However, I frequent here for the ambiance even if it's just for a drink. Beautiful rustic building and restaurant. The fries and pumpkin salad are my usual here.

IV-rhXDkHPGc_ORZAcnK7w.text: How can I miss this spot after shopping around the cold storage beneath for so many years? This explains why. The burger is good and so are the fries. They aren't fan-f-tasting but it's those great thick potato chips great for sharing. We had a few dishes to share. Onion rings with curry mayo; otak; mushroom soup and homemade foccacia. The bread was utterly disappointing, a thin slice for sharing when we thought it came with the soup. Onion rings were a winner! Burger came fast and it took us only a few minutes to stuff our bellies. The char siew was a little too sweet for our liking. Friend describe it as eating a chocolate cake but in a meat form. Nevertheless, if you like char siew & bbq sauce, go for it. Ramlee burger was decent. With that I can only say that I'm a snob, because we are used to messy processed patty with all the silly sauces and kraft blue tub. Still, I really enjoyed the dish. Love the thai radish/cucumber salad. It was really refreshing and flavourful. Dessert was, well, bad. Sorry but I can't stand a dry cake, even after you slap it with a scoop of ice cream. Service was brilliant. Two guys running the front on a weekday, brilliant job! It's a great spot to chill out with friends and family but casual dining.

hLB6SoM3yF3-q2uPKg5OWQ.text: Enter Relish, a 3-year-old burger joint opened by Wild Rocket. Unlike the uppity image the parent restaurant may conjure, Relish positions itself as the "fun family homeboy" offspring of the F&B group.For mains, T had the Wild Rocket Burger ($14.50++ for 150g) which was served quite simply with arugala, Sarawak pepper cream, and sundried tomato relish, coupled with a side of chips. I can't help feeling that truffle fries, the smell of which was wafting from the next table, would've been a nicer touch to the plate.E, on the other hand, was tempted into Spaghetti Arrabiata ($17.50++). In her words, it was "really good!" which in any case, was good enough for me knowing that food is genuinely being enjoyed.I was feeling under the weather so I had to tear myself away from the meat and battered food. I picked the Butterfish in Cilantro Pesto Sauce ($26.00++). I had ordered the most lackluster (and not to mention, the most expensive) dish at the table for the night. To give credits, the fish was nicely grilled but it was rather tough - I couldn't decide if butterfish were meant to be so and it was just my Asian tastebuds being used to smooth silky fish meat. Nevertheless, the dish did not quite make its worth.A great place to head down to wind down with close friends and family. I'll say stick to the burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore

WZnnJv6aVA2kvysYs4NSJg.text: It's a little painful to pay over $100 for a plate of sweet potato fries, their Ramly-style burger, their portobello tofu burger, and 4 330ml beers. That said, the sweet potato fries were awesome, the beers (Taiwanese Lychee beer) were delicious, and the burgers satisfactory, so in terms of quality one can't really complain. It was the beers really, that pushed the bill into the 100+ mark.I love the blue cheese and pear burger here, and the only reason I didn't have that was because Marcus mentioned that the Ramly is new on the menu, and hey, I love Ramly burgers. Having tried it though, the one at the Burger Shack down the road is better. I'm not sure if the Burger Shack is still there actually. :/I've also tried their steak (pretty average), the mushroom soup (really quite tasty), and nibbled on the... dried prawn pasta from a friend. All said and done, the food here is reliable, the service usually very good, and the selection of beers is a definite pull. It's a little bit pricey, all said and done, but...They don't serve that Taiwanese Lychee beer just anywhere, and together with the blue cheese and pear burger? Mmm that's worth going back time and again.

oeHjEU7cHPc4teX9Y1X2wg.text: Posh burgers, and posh pastas too.My friend raves about an "off-the-menu" lobster linguine, but I'm more of a by-the-book kinda guy, so menu items it is for me. I've had most of their burgers, and I'd say the soft-shell crab one is pretty good, and you should also try the char siew open-faced burger too... I like char siew lah. I really do. The Girlfriend likes a good smelly cheese, so she's a fan of the Blue Cheese burger... I just try not to breathe when she has that one. I just heard about a menu revamp, and apparently there's a Ramly wannabe, so that's on my list next. Eh it's Ramly leh! How not to try?One of the things I'm mad about is their onion rings, which comes with a curry dip. While most of you will read this and go... really dude? Onion rings? I say give them a go. Crispy as they should be, with REAL onion rings under that batter. Dunk it in the curry dip, and it makes all the difference. Go ahead. Do it. Do it for me. I need to watch my cholesterol levels.

HNo7FER9Nwne-fmr4N4q-g.text: The burgers here pack a punch. I had the Blue Cheese burger which was served with a generous portion of sides, Fries. The prices for the burgers are under $20 and have quite unique flavours such as the vegeterian portobello burger. The atmosphere here is laid-back, and the staff are attentive and conscientious.My mum and I made a reservation in advance, so we didnt' really have to wait. But if you want a fuss-free dining experience, do call this place up in advance.

OgCJec3wiQtU75kO7X1h_g.text: A very convenient location to get to, Relish is just beside the botanical gardens MRT. Located on the 2nd floor, it's got a little view and a great ambience with a lush wooden interior. It does get quite crowded during lunch and dinner times though.The coffee here was rather disappointing. It was kind of watery and flavorless. I went there on a quiet Saturday late afternoon and there were only 2 or 3 other tables occupied, but service was slow and in attentive. The staff were more interested in talking amongst themselves. Also when I'd asked about all day breakfast, the waiter rather condescendingly said, "But you're too late. Until 4 only." Really, I was very unimpressed by his attitude and felt rather offended. I can think of at least 10 different ways be could have said that nicely, with a smile.I ordered the burger with blue cheese and poached pear and it was stunning. I really enjoyed the mix of flavors as the fresh meat patties used. Very juicy and perfectly cooked to a medium done-ness. Definitely worth a try! I hope they have better service next time i go there to try the brunch menu.

ySPfnfZq6QeKKW4E3i-lPA.text: Relish is one of the better burger joints in town even if their prices veer slightly north. Food : Love the seafood burger and the Relish burger but most of all I love the alcoholic milkshakes!Ambience : Airy and casual, good place for weekend brunch Service : Hit and miss

ewaDf-Pw3g8Qkh-3gyrKlA.text: When Relish first started out, it was mostly a gourmet burger place. Now with the menu re-vamp, it is more bistro-like (ie, pastas, salads) but fortunately, most of the burgers are still on the menu. I really like the beer-and-burger pairings, and am a sucker for onion rings. I don't know why more burger places don't do onion rings. OMNOMNOMAlso: save room for dessert. Their selection of cakes is awesome. Its location, by the way, is fantastic--post Botanic Gardens rambling, just come over to fuel-up!

R1gHRvI6rUAzDaNA3Kdehw.text: Im not such a fan of this place. Wild Rocket is a burger joint in the Bukit Timah area. The restaurant itself has a nice vibe and atmosphere. The menu is an interesting fusion of east and west. Those are the things its has going for them. But I was disappointed eating here. First of all-- the prices are expensive. Its almost like eating in PS Cafe or something. I ordered the vegetarian portobello mushroom burger. Disappointing to say the least. It wasnt even warm, the cheese they used seemed to be Kraft cheese slices. Just not good at all, for more that $20. I will not be going back here.

AQN3MG3wKXupdnXOjI1TSA.text: Gourmet Burgers are on the rise and giving fast food joints a run for their money. Offering quality meat and fresh condiments, Relish's gourmet burgers pack an explosion of flavors with every bite! Try the Ramly Burger for a truly authentic asian burger experience. Instead of the usual condiment stacking in a regular burger, all toppings including the beef patty are wrapped in a thin layered omelet, hence creating a packet of intense flavors. If you're in the mood for a western adventure, go on and give the Poached Pear and Blue Cheese Burger a shot. If you need more toppings to satisfy your taste buds, add-ons are available for small fee. Wild Rocket also serves the occasional Asian inspired pasta which might prove a little spicy for some so be sure to check with your server. And finally, my personal favorite on the menu, the Relish Deconstructed Strawberry Cheesecake. The textured layers of cookie crumble, cream cheese and fresh strawberries ensure a sweet but light ending to the hearty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Relish By Wild Rocket - Singapore, Singapore
